image.altText: Ashley McGregor has a blonde beard and is wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A father has been found guilty of the manslaughter and criminal neglect of his 21-day-old son, who sustained injuries consistent with a high-impact car crash.

title.children: Father guilty of killing baby son whose injuries were like car crash victim

image.altText: Staff follow Mathew Hawkins outside the hotel moments before he punches Luke Sweetman

props.synopsis: South Australia's Supreme Court has released CCTV footage of Mathew Hawkins's fatal one-punch attack on Luke Sweetman — who was backing away — when he was struck outside a suburban Adelaide hotel.

title.children: Fatal one-punch attack of 'fun-loving' man caught on CCTV

image.altText: cracked dry soil surrounded by dry shrub

props.synopsis: An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia, and those impacted want a future plan to make sure they have enough water to survive, writes Meagan Dillon.

title.children: 'Water is a basic need': An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia

image.altText: A man lays on the ground with a tree branch strewn across a driveway surrounded by emergency services personnel

props.synopsis: An Adelaide couple has escaped serious injuries after they were hit by a falling tree branch in their driveway on Tuesday – a day after a festival-goer was taken to hospital when a branch fell during WOMAD. Warning: This story contains graphic images.

title.children: Adelaide couple injured in second falling tree branch incident this week

image.altText: An x-ray of a baby who swallowed a button battery.

props.synopsis: Baby Adèle is now on the road to recovery, but two months ago she was in intensive care after swallowing a button battery, leaving her parents completely petrified and fearing "she might not make it".

title.children: Button battery nightmare prompts parents to keep technology sealed

image.altText: A woman in a headscarf sitting under a tree.

props.synopsis: A newly-opened multi-million-dollar apartment complex in Adelaide's CBD will help women like Kiran escape from violent relationships.

title.children: Affordable apartments to help family violence survivors 'rebuild their lives'

image.altText: A large lightning bolt strikes Portland

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old woman was taken to Millicent hospital with non-life-threatening injuries during a severe thunderstorm, which also sparked close to 100 fires and left thousands without power.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning in SA's South East during severe thunderstorms

image.altText: A night scene of a tree branch fallen on the ground, with lights strung up behind

props.synopsis: Two people were injured — and one was taken to hospital — when a tree branch fell in Botanic Park during the WOMADelaide festival on Monday. Emergency services are urging people to take care near heat stressed trees after a hot summer.

title.children: Two injured in 'awful, tragic' tree branch fall during WOMADelaide

image.altText: A woman outstretched her hands while singing into a microphone stand. A stage light illuminates her from below.

props.synopsis: You might come to WOMADelaide for the headliners, but you'll leave with a new favourite band.

title.children: Forget your favourites — WOMADelaide's best moments come from new discoveries

image.altText: A large bin parked in a carpark outside a childcare facility

props.synopsis: A former employee of childcare provider Genius Education says the company owes staff thousands in unpaid superannuation and workers were not able to say a proper goodbye to the children they cared for.

title.children: Worker claims childcare company owes staff thousands of dollars in super

image.altText: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm stand on dry and cracked ground, in front of a small dam

props.synopsis: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm say they would be "in big trouble" if they were not able to pump water from a neighbour's dam. They are calling on the state government to provide more support for farmers enduring the current drought conditions.

title.children: SA farmers 'battling through some of the toughest times I can remember'

image.altText: A woman holding a nail gun on a construction site

props.synopsis: As Australia's construction industry continues to suffer from a worker shortage, some female tradies say more women want to take up the tools but are prevented by sexist attitudes on the job site.

title.children: Chippy loves her trade, but says sexist remarks are a barrier for women

image.altText: A cave diver wearing a yellow helmet, blue mask and black wetsuit squeezes between rocks.

props.synopsis: Curious divers on South Australia's Limestone Coast are hoping to one day be able to dive into one cave and come out another, after discovering an underground tunnel.

title.children: Cave divers' push to unexplored territory uncovers 100m tunnel

image.altText: A wind turbine, as seen from close proximity, towering above bushland where other turbines stand.

props.synopsis: Residents in the south-west Victorian town of Nelson say building the some of the biggest wind turbines in Australia will harm the look and environment of the picturesque area.

title.children: 270m-high wind turbine plan generates opposition in Victorian town

image.altText: A guard tower in a correctional centre behind razor wire.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for public assistance to help locate a 28-year-old man who escaped from Broken Hill Correctional Centre on Sunday.

title.children: Police hunt inmate who escaped outback correctional centre

image.altText: Starmer, Macron and Zelenskyy huddle together

props.synopsis: World leaders are reacting to the news that Ukraine has expressed a willingness to accept an immediate 30-day ceasefire in the war with Russia. Follow live.

title.children: Russia yet to commit to US-brokered ceasefire with Ukraine

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: SA's Public Service Association has called for urgent reform, claiming three prisoners have been violently assaulted by other inmates in the past week — with each incident resulting in hospitalisations.

title.children: Prisoner in hospital after third violent attack in week, SA union says

image.altText: Tom Campbell poses with a football at the MCG after signing with Melbourne

props.synopsis: They're the backbone of every sporting team, the bench players who spend months or even years waiting to get their moment in the spotlight.

title.children: Here's to bench warmers, the unsung heroes of sporting teams

image.altText: A teenage girl whose face is pixelated lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Kmart is investigating the incident and the 13-year-old girl's mother hopes her story will alert other parents to the potential dangers of products used by young people.

title.children: Kmart pulls skincare product after teen hospitalised with eye pain

image.altText: A female police officer in formal wear leading a woman in black clothing and handcuffs through a car park.

props.synopsis: A 50-year-old female Australian Border Force employee and an alleged crime figure have been charged with bribery and drug offences.

title.children: Border force supervisor charged with bribery and drug offences

image.altText: Flames and smoke visible on hills

props.synopsis: Tasmania has been treated to both ends of the weather spectrum, with a bushfire burning near a west coast town as a massive storm front delivers large hail across other parts of the state.

title.children: Fire threat to Tasmanian town gives way to storms, hail

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX tumbles as the White House confirms there will be no tariff exemptions for Australian steel and aluminium. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX tumbles as US rejects tariff exemption for Australia, ASIC sues Australian Super

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Steel communities hope for opportunity in US tariff war

image.altText: A crocodile in brown water looking straight on at the camera close-up like a portrait.

props.synopsis: A new study suggests nutrient-rich crocodile poop could be benefiting wetland vegetation in the Top End while predation pressure limits feral pig damage.

title.children: Saltwater crocs' feral pig diet may be changing NT waterways

image.altText: Large boxes of illegal cigarettes at a warehouse in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler was in Melbourne on Wednesday to announce about $160 million in extra funds in an effort to stamp out the rampant illicit tobacco trade.

title.children: Federal government announces extra $160m to fight illegal cigarette trade

image.altText: A graphic showing Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese in front of a property.

props.synopsis: The revelation that an explosives-filled caravan initially believed to be part of an antisemitic terror plot was in fact a "criminal con job" has kicked off a convoluted political stoush over who knew what when.

title.children: The caravan and the 'con job': How a fake terror plot consumed parliament

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man stands with several other people at a function

props.synopsis: The WA Greens say strengthening the government’s climate change legislation will be a top priority after they seize the balance of power in the upper house.

title.children: As Labor loses total control, WA's upper house is set to get interesting

image.altText: A man looks out the round window of a plane

props.synopsis: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. confirms Rodrigo Duterte is on his way to the International Criminal Court after his arrest in Manila.

title.children: Philippines' ex-president Rodrigo Duterte on plane to Hague after arrest

image.altText: Clayton's Towing to the rescue after couple drives into floodwaters

props.synopsis: A woman who was trapped in a ute after it ploughed into floodwaters amid record rainfall is speaking out to thank her rescuers and warn even the most wary of motorists.

title.children: Chilling video shows couple accidentally hitting floodwater

image.altText: A bride and groom dancing in a candlelit room.

props.synopsis: After exploding on Australian screens in the early 2000s, reality TV is still going strong. But the format consistently hits the headlines for all the wrong reasons.

title.children: Reality TV controversies keep on coming, so why are we still watching?

image.altText: A photo which shows Gove refinery from the air. Gove Operations is located on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem land.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has lost a High Court battle over whether it should be liable for compensation for lost or impaired native title rights over a mining lease on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem Land.

title.children: Commonwealth loses High Court battle in native title compensation claim over Gove Peninsula

image.altText: Woman posed for a photoin nature, wearing a patterned dress

props.synopsis: Deanne Mathews, a self-described "healer and mentor", pleads guilty to drug trafficking after serving magic mushrooms to a woman who died at a Victorian health retreat.

title.children: 'Healing ceremony' organiser who served mushroom drink to woman who died pleads guilty to drug charge

image.altText: Three Israeli police officers standing outside a bookshop.

props.synopsis: The owner of the bookshop in East Jerusalem was arrested and authorities confiscated books, a month after accusing the family running the store of breaching the peace.

title.children: Israeli police raid Palestinian-run bookshop for second time in a month

image.altText: lifeguard tower in sand falling over

props.synopsis: Eighty per cent of the tourist strip's famous beaches have been carved away by Tropical Cyclone Alfred but the mayor says they will be back to their best for the Easter holidays.

title.children: 'The beach is just gone': Race on to fix Gold Coast erosion after cyclone
